page.title: 03 Martinstown Village.
page.content: Martinstown is a pretty village of about 500 inhabitants, three and a half miles west of Dorchester.Maiden Castle lies on its boundary.Most of the land is agricutural and many of the people living in the village find employment on the farms. Most of these are dairy farms and it is a common sight to see cattle grazing in the fields and the milk tankers doing its rounds along the lanes. In the centre of the village is the beautiful church of St.Martins, looking out onto the village green and the one main road which follows the stream. Close by is the only shop and Post Office, with the Brewers Arms further along.There are twelve old thatched cottages which nestle around St.Martin s,the oldest part of the village.
